bug.author: treuille
bug.summary: Confusing advice in exception when calling `st.sidebar.write`.
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h1>Summary</denchmark-h>
The bug you get when you call st.sidebar.write confusingly suggests (probably) the wrong rememdy to the user's bug. <denchmark-h:h1>Steps to reproduce</denchmark-h>
Run this: st.sidebar.write('xyz') <denchmark-h:h1>Actual Behavior</denchmark-h>
What you see is: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1673013/65732771-34ee9f00-e080-11e9-9ed3-88e609778721.png></denchmark-link>
which is almost perfect. <denchmark-h:h2>Expected behavior</denchmark-h>
I think it should suggest st.sidebar.markdown which is more likely what I wanted rather than st.write. <denchmark-h:h1>Additional information</denchmark-h>
Why doesn't st.sidebar.write just work, btw. Shouldn't it?

comments.comment:
Why doesn't st.sidebar.write just work, btw. Shouldn't it?
It will soon. This warning was a stop-gap solution. The warning itself is dynamically-generated and contains no logic specific to st.write -- so given that this whole thing is a temporary measure anyway I'm not sure we should spend time adding an st.write-specific branch that proposes st.sidebar.markdown as an alternative.
